reviews.review_msg: Class was fairly easy but exams were a bit unreasonable and would test irrelevant material. She could not use web ct to post marks and it would take her sometimes two weeks to post exam marks. The exams were multiple choice and should not have taken so long. i also found her very annoying

Dana was such a sweetheart! If you read the chapters she assigned before class, you'll have no trouble following in class. She focuses a lot on archaeological sites - read about those a lot! Her slides were easy to follow and usually interesting and her exams were relatively easy too.

Doug is the best professor! If he didn't have such a hot ass, I would have stared at his face all day.  He opened my mind to the beauties of the world and made me want to explore the vast abyss of the dark unknown in Tumbleheridge.

You have to memorize every details from the book if you want to get a normal grade (B onward). The exams have 4 parts : MCQs, Short questions, Essay, and Map. Short Qs and essays are not difficult, you'll be just fine if you are willing to write. MCQs and Map are tricky.  Average was C.

Douglas Ross is a decent professor that is able to show interest in course material and convey these to his students. As for the two mid-terms and one final, you need to study from both lectures and textbook in order to do good in this course. So attend class and take notes! Lectures are quite vague!

This course content itself wasn't too bad, but as a condensed course INSANE. Get ready to write down every single detail in the slides, and that he says in the lectures, and you'll at least get a B+ on open book exams. 33% for 3 exams, 60 mins for 60 questions. If youre ready to put in the work can be a GPA booster.

60 minute 60 question test worth 33% of your grade, his lectures are fine and the exam is open book yet it's insane when you have slow wifi canvas takes forever to refresh which crunches on the time. Questions are designed to get you through misreading, which is common when you literally almost less than a minute per question. Grading is messed up.

David Maxwell is chill, and his lectures are surprisingly interestingâ€”which is impressive considering it's archaeology. But he makes it engaging, especially with his lecture recordings. The course? Easy - 5 quizzes (carry your grade) and 2 assignments (dropped mine faster than a bad stock pick). Overall: fun, doable, don't mess up the assignments!

100% of your grade comes from 3 online exams. There is a lot of information to memorize.  It was very difficult for me. While exams are open book, answering 60 questions in 60 minutes is simply not enough time. If you are good at remembering take the course, otherwise try to avoid.

The class had only 2 midterms and a final. The questions were extremely nit-picky (like what was significant about *year*). I took this as an elective and it was not a GPA booster. The lecture slides are disorganized and the insignificant material that is barely mentioned will be on the midterms and final.

4000+ words for each lecture.. for real somebody needs to teach him how to present information properly...he literally will use slides that have 200+ words on each slide. Most information is useless but you wont know until after the quizzes so get it all down! If you are not interested in rocks then this may be the most boring class you take
Definitely do not take him online, reads off lectures and has no scaling even though the quiz averages are bad. Quizzes are extremely hard and barely any time to finish them.

David was a decent professor, but there is a lot of content and memorization in the course, so lectures can often get dull. For the exams, make sure to review the lecture slides AND assigned articles as there were a few questions from the articles. The course had 2 midterms and 1 final, and the exam content was pretty similar to the lectures.

I took arch101. Exams were online and open book however, the questions are long and short answers and I don't understand how it was marked. There was to rubric or tips on how to do well on them. Lectures are long and you can't speed them up. I didn't read the TB but it's recommended. The 2nd assignment is confusing so get help ahead of time.
DO NOT TAKE FOR GPA BOOSTER! HIS EXAMS ARE NOT THE BEST! I REGRETTED EVERY SECOND OF IT !

David is an overall nice guy when you talk to him. But get ready to read so much because that's all this course is, each week is basically 5 or 6 PowerPoints consisting of 30 slides with walls of text each time. Also be prepared to just have that all somehow memorized in order to take the exam. Stay away if you can!

No joke, 1030 slides filled with paragraphs of information throughout the semester. Watching the lectures each week takes about 3-4 hours total, which is just the prof reading the slides. Grade is divided into 3 midterms, which are ambiguous and asks questions about material he did not talk about in lectures. NOT a GPA booster.
Great prof, would answer any questions that you have. but his grading scale is different. I got 80%, but got a B not a B+

Grades are 100% based on exams, and many of the questions have terrible ambiguous answers. Lectures start get be really rushed, and you'll need to know materials he talks about, but not included in the slides.

Dr. Maxwell is a great professor. So kind and understanding even when taking an online class with him. He is very clear in his lectures and taking good notes of what he says in the lectures is key to doing well on his exams. He's very accommodating and overall a great prof and nice guy! defs recommend if you need an elective and take good notes

Took this class as a gpa booster but it ended up paining me. 60 mcq in one hour but there was so much content to remember. In total, over 400 slides to learn for each midterm and doing this for intersession made it worse. This course was not easy and not worth taking as a gpa booster because unless you spend a lot of time memorizing its not worth

I took this class as an intersession course because I was interested in the topic and heard great things about the course. But the way that the prof laid out and graded the course really put a downer on the content. Found myself spending more time trying to remember an enormous amount of lecture and reading content rather than being engaged.

Not what i expected out of a supposed "gpa booster" class. Exams were really tough and memorization was almost impossible since there were over 1000 lecture slides. Open-book exams but there's almost no time to browse through notes since you have 1h for 60 mcq. Some questions are also worded to trick you, which made the exams painfully confusing.

Like everyone mentioned, this class is way too difficult for a 100 level course, too much content to memorize. I was looking into archeology as a degree prior to this course but it completely turned me off the subject and made me hate everything about it. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS

lectures are very detailed. the lecture slides are filled with information and you cant memorize it at all. It is basically like he writes short stories on each slide to a total of almost 1100 slides+. I wouldn't recommend taking this class unless you have photographic memory. The open book aspect is useless bc there isn't enough time to search.

Avoid avoid avoid.
The Final was cumulative. imagine around 1000 slides for memorization! exams are not fair 60 questions in 60 minutes although it is open book but you don't find time to use your notes.

Dr. Maxwell is a great lecturer! Although some of the week's materials are long, there's never a dull moment & all of the topics are super interesting. He's been a great marker (very fair) & seems like an absolute gem of a guy. I already have another course (ARCH226) with him for next semester & I'm very excited!

Was above the average for both midterms but still ended up with a B, overall pretty easy class no surprises on midterms and the final, all the material is in the lecture notes, grade consists of 3 exams. Pretty easy class though, didnt really study much just read through the notes. Lecture slides are pretty long tho

I can't say enough about David - he's an amazing prof and makes the lectures as enjoyable as he can. He's very responsive and understanding if you need to reschedule due to conflicts. There is lots of info to know but tests arent cumulative, so pretty easy to do well overall if you watch lectures and take notes. Would highly recommend Dr Maxwell :)

David is such a sweet prof, i would highly recommend him for arch courses! He's really understanding and makes the content interesting (there's a lot of content and lots to know). 3 tests, non-cumulative, all open book. Not the easiest, but still manageable to get an A w/ little to no work as long as you watch the lectures
Great guy, has humor and makes the lectures seem interesting even to the uninterested. Really fair in marking.

Very funny and obviously incredibly smart guy, exams are super fair if you memorize the lectures and truly understand them for the written portions which usually are more concept based than just regurgitating facts. 11/10 guy!
I enjoyed his class so much. He's so knowledgeable and is a great story teller. I will definitely try and take as many classes as I can with him.

Max isn't the only thing he does well, David is a great teacher. I was in a three hour lecture once a week and the slides are about 100-120 pages with quite a lot of content on each slide. David just knows it all. I think even if i was just describing what the slides looked like I wouldn't get as much detail as he does about the actual content.

David's lectures were very heavy, power points averaged 100 slides per week. There are four midterms and no finals. If you study and review you can get a good grade. Good class but effort is required.

Overall a pretty decent professor. He is really passionate about archeology, he is available outside of class, and exams are fair and easy if you put in some effort. Lectures were not mandatory but theyre recorded and posted online, along with the notes.
Honestly, a really fair and honest prof. He's a really passionate guy and really wants his students to do well. The kahoots and lecture recordings helped a lot.

Dr. Maxwell genuinely loves what he teaches and it shows during lectures. His humour is a little dry, but in a good way, and he has lots of cool anecdotes that relate to the course. His exams are fairly easy and based entirely on lecture notes, no surprises. Overall, he is an understanding and a caring prof.
Nice prof and super easy tests

This is a pretty easy course if youre somewhat interested in the material. The content is pretty dry tho David makes it bearable cuz hes funny. Exams were so easy, mostly based on the lecture slides and a few questions from the textbook and films we watched in class. I would definitely take this class again!

Maxwell is funny and nice but his lectures are very dry and boring. No need To go to class as lectures are recorded and Slides posted online. His exams are based off the slides and the readings (you must read!!) , & each ppt has well over 100 slides (LOTS of info). 2 midterms and 1 final. All MC ques. Fairly easy.

Tips to pass EASY AND STRESS FREE: 1. Skip class. 2. Cram lecture slides (with recorded lectures) in the days before the exam. 3. Watch in-class videos-- usually a short answer on the exam Great Prof. Easy to listen to. If you're bored, count how many times he says something along the lines of "we don't know". I hit 78.
Great professor, really enjoyed the classes i have taken with him. class does tend to be a little dry sometimes, but he try hard to keep it interesting. would definitely recommend.
Such a good prof who is passionate about what he teaches, and he's funny. Loved this course with david!

I took this class as a GPA booster but it's actually not. The material is so boring and you have to know too much stuff just for a midterm. There's about 90-120 slides each week and you have to know every because anything is fair game for the exams. Don't get me wrong he's an okay prof but the class is just so boring

David is a solid prof. Beware this course isn't a GPA booster as people make it sound like. The only thing you need to study for the final and midterms is the lecture notes. The textbook is useless.  My advice is to review lecture notes constantly and also understand the meaning behind each slide (Pay attention to what he says for each slide)

Super inspirational prof. David Maximus III of Stonehenge Palace taught me the fundamentals of Archaeology. What really got me going in this subject is his passion for the subject and my interest in lithic artifacts. Do not skip class as he is hilarious and looks like Garfield (a good thing)

He's a nice guy, but after the first midterm the tests got really hard. He would tell you not to worry about the dates, but still ending up testing about them on the exam. Be sure to have a textbook for the lec material since his lectures are really vague and contains non relevant technical details.

The course material was interesting but it was hard to stay awake in lectures (they're recorded). The exams (MT1 33%, MT2 33%, F 34%) were slightly annoying because there were questions included that he specifically said not to bother remembering... Exams are mostly M/C with a few short answer so this is a great course if you are good at memorizing
He is good but the cource is too hard

He is very knowledgeable in everything he teaches. Course content is honestly VERY boring, but he's just so funny!! All ppt slides and lecture recordings are online, but you can't get a good mark if you just study the slides without the context he provides during lectures. So either go to lectures or listen to recordings. Do ALL the Kahoot quizzes!

Great prof... buy if you want to do well on mid terms you have to study like everything single detail on the lecture slides!!! The final is basically like a third midterm but with 2 essay questions :) Also, didn't have to buy the textbook which was great cause everything you need to know is in his notes:))

He seems really interested in what he teaches, and really knows the topics top to bottom. Be sure to know all of the terms for the exams, specifically from the side of the pages on the textbooks, and focus on broad ideas over small details. Also, it doesn't seem like a lot to learn but he will test on almost everything, so be sure to study slides.

what makes this class hard is studying the boring lectures. The material is super dry and uninteresting that it makes it hard to sit down and memorize the slides. Due to someone cheating on the first midterm, our second midterm consisted of a written portion (not that easy). Good lecturer -  wouldn't recommend unless you find the topics intersting
easy course, easy prof. lecture slides are basically all you need to know for this course. 2 midterms and a final, but the final is really just a third midterm. course material was interesting too

You have three exams - all multiple choice and non-cumulative. All the information that you need to know is on the lecture slides the he posts. He has a dry/sarcastic sense of humor. He makes me think of the grumpy cat meme - but in a good way.
His class was rather easy but his exams were a little tough. The content is very dry and there's a lot to cover. Overall, his lectures are great, and he's very passionate about his field of study.
So good! Great prof, I would recommend this course with him. Very very easy!

He's extremely passionate about his field! I had no interest (and still don't) for this class, but his enthusiasm made me actually enjoy the class. He is very clear about grading, and tries his hard to make the course approachable by everyone. The course itself is fairly easy. Also, his notes are extremely comprehensive, and cover everything!

He is very clear and gets to the point. Doesn't dwell on details like other profs do. Tells us what isn't going to be on the exams when he is doing the lectures. Basically studied hard for three days before the final and got 100%. and his exams are all non cumulative, including the final. Great Prof and got me very interested in archaeology
Great prof! Passionate and funny. Lots of memorization needed to do well on tests but it's not so bad.

One of my favourite professors. His class was simply great with 3 multiple choice exams, non-cumulative. Study off his lecture slides and you should do well. Lecture attendance is not required but you should attend when he plays movies.

Great prof. He is very understanding of his students and does not expect too much from them which is great. You can tell he is passionate about his subject. The material he teaches can be pretty interesting and all the exams are fair. Just focus on his lecture slides!

Class was somewhat interesting, David Maxwell was an amazing professor, one of the best I have had. Lecture attendance is optional, however 1-2 questions out of 75 on each mid term are based off of an inclass movie. Study the lecture slides only and this class should be at least an easy B to B+ depending on your dedication.

3 MC non-cumulative exams, super interesting lectures, nice teacher; the perfect combinations for a gpa booster. you can skip class since everything he says is on his slides but his lectures are worth it. exams are entirely based on his slides and the textbook that you will absolutely need. will definitely take another class with him.

This class is ridiculously easy. There is no point in attending classes because everything he says is on the slides. Attend when movies are shown. Easy A, GPA booster. 3 non-cumulative MC exams which are a joke. Material is interesting as well.

This class is easy if you keep up with the lecture notes. The textbook is not mandatory, all of his exams are multiple choice and non-cumulative. This class is literally all memorization, but there is a lot of material. It's pretty easy to achieve a B in this course.
This class is really interesting.  You don't really need the textbook.  He's a little bit dry but it shows that he's really passionate about his subject.  I would recommend taking it for sure.

Great prof, very clear lectures & engaging. The only thing is, come exams you will die from memorizing every little fact from the powerpoints since that's what he bases the exams off of. There's a ton of cultures and random facts to remember and most of them aren't really linked. Have fun memorizing 400slides for exams I'm doing that right now!

Very fair prof, fairly easy class. Focus on his lecture notes, but do the readings also as he tests on those too. All exams are m/c. Class obviously requires effort; I'd say light-medium workload. Awesome elective if you need one.

Grreeeaaattt teacher!! some materials may be lacking exciting information but overall its a great course..3 non cumulative midterms=good time..except his final was a little off but he is usually very fair with his tests!
If you like a professor that rambles on and on and doesn't follow any structured teaching guidelines, then he's the guy for you!

He is very enthusiastic about archaeology and because of that i really enjoyed taking his class! He does not care about dates/names but rather the concepts! His powerpoints are horrible but the content is relatively simple. GPA BOOST! RECOMMEND FOR ANYONE.

BORING!!! Very unorganized skips around too much, has pictures layered over slides, doesn't follow text (only useful for myanthro kit which is only 10%) Exam/Quizz lecture based! Final cumulative but focuses on cultural heritage and the Andes. Some questions r worded badly so he allows ppl 2 challenge them and has optional essays as bonus marks

DISORGANIZED. Lectures & ppts have nothing to do with the readings assigned. The textbook is straight forward whereas this prof goes back and forth jumping around topics. He seems enthusiastic about the course content but ARCH100 with him just seriously didn't cut it for me. I would not recommend others to take ARCH with him.

A+ Prof! A very passionate prof. and knows what he's talking about. He encourages active participation and learning throughout the course. Plus extra bonus marks. Really loved his class and his exams are fair. The text informative and his course work was useful. Awesome prof overall and the TAs as well.

If you take arch 100 with Higueras, do not bother with the textbook. The exams are pretty much whatever he puts emphasis on in lecture, and it usually has little to do with the textbook. It isn't all bad, though. The content is interesting, he can be kind of funny, and he gives you chances to improve your grade. Just go to lecture!!

This 3 hour long class seemed like it would be simple, but because this teacher didn't REALLY stick to the text book it was confusing. If you missed a class you probably missed important topics. When it came to quizzes and exams most of the questions were worded funny just to make the questions harder otherwise it would have been an easy course.

His classes are great to take a nap in. In all seriousness though, he's passionate about the course and wants his students to do well. Grades are based off of two midterms, so study each like your life depended on it!!!
Easy class. Clear lectures, follow slides and you will do well.

A great professor. The material could get super boring, but he tried to keep it interesting. Midterm was all M/C, and final was M/C with an essay. Studying the lecture notes is essential to passing - textbook not necessary at all. Would recommend this course to anyone needing the breadth requirement.

Dennis is a great prof. He's super likable and adds humor when he can. The course can be a bit dry at times but there is a lot of interesting content in there as well. The entire mark for this course was based on the midterm and final, both were multiple choice. Super easy to pass and to do well you just need to study.

I took this class as an elective but it ended up being my favourite for the semester. Very good at lecturing . Plus it  was nice only having a midterm and a final . Textbook not necessary for this class - study lecture slides including the small details.

picture perfect university prof. Lectures can be dry sometimes but easy course load. Exams weren't too bad and has a good sense of humour but not the most exciting class especially if your just fulfilling a breadth requirement
Very easy and understandable prof. His slides are great and the information is clear. 10/10 would take course again.

Such a simple class. Sure there seems to be a lot of info but if you put a little work into studying you'll do great! Go to class, take notes, and have an easy time on the exams. His midterm took me about 5 mins (all multiple choice) and final took about an hour (MC with an essay). He's also a great lecturer

Took both his intersessions courses Arch100 and 131. Great Prof, cares about all his students and always takes time to encourage to ask questions. Very knowledgable in his field, and has a great sense of humour. Textbook not really mandatory, but listen to his lecture and take down good notes since his Q's on MT and Exams are on it. Love this Prof
not a great guy. very unresponsive and unwilling to listen
Super nice guy and great GPA booster. He randomly marked the last assignment super hard and kinda just assumed everybody was cheating which was a little unfair.

Class was amazing, took the class online this semester and Bob was always replying to emails instantly, I will say if you want to get an A you must study and prep hard before his quizzes. The content itself isn't hard however there's a lot per lecture and the lectures can be super boring at times.Bob overall was a nice guy who wanted you to succeed

Make use of office hours to get recommendations and feedback as it can be quite helpful. All in all, Mr. Muir is a great prof who is an expert in the field of Archaeology and loves teaching it. Arch100 is a basic course so it shouldn't be a problem.
You should take this

Catherine is an amazing prof. She is extremely interested in archaeology and if you allow her to, she will get you interested in the subject as well. In order to do well, go to all of her lectures (when the TA's aren't teaching) and take notes for all slides. This class has made me contemplate doing a minor in ARCH.

If you go through the readings and take really great notes (as in, write down basically everything she says) and then study those notes, you will find it easy to get an A+. Just skim over the readings if you want (know the bold terms), though there weren't many exam questions on the readings.
She is a good prof. Lecture is quite boring. The grades marked by 4 quizs. If u read her lecture notes you can get B, if u can spend time on textbook, trust me, easy A.

She's a great professor who really cares for her students. When we fell behind, Catherine cut her notes down instead of rushing through material. Although the readings were supposedly examinable, I haven't done any and I've managed an average above 90%. So, use the recordings, take detailed notes, memorize as much as you can and you'll get an A+.

Easy course, just lots of memorization for quizzes. no mid, final, or assignments. Just skim the text, most of it covered in lecture. SFU should just abolish these breadth courses, as they are ridiculous for both the students pursuing a completely different discipline and the profs who have to teach students who have no interest in the material.

Had no sense of timing. Would rush through lectures, jumping around slides, only to dismiss the class an hour early. Would also dismiss class if she sensed lack of interest, which led to falling an entire 3-hour lecture behind. I felt extremely frustrated most of the time. Tests are fairly easy, all multiple-choice. Doesn't feel approachable.
She really cares about her area of expertise and it shows. She can be tough, but she is fair and will go out of her way to help you if you need it. And on top of that, I find her very attractive.

She is a fair prof who is very approachable and understanding. Her notes are clear and interesting - she provides lots of pictures to help understand as well as enhance our knowledge. Her exams are multiple choice.. as long as you study all her notes and read the textbook you are gauranteed an A!

This class was pretty easy. Didnt ever have to attend lecture as she posted powerpoint and recordings online. All you have to do is make sure you read the powerpoints and the text and you're guaranteed at least a B in this class. The only problem was that the tests were all multiple choice(which i dont prefer, but some of you may like it)

She is a good prof.  She knows what she is talking about and fills the lectures with lots of interesting information.  But her test format is quite difficult.  When she had multiple choice everyone excelled, when she got rid of it, everyone failed.  Make sure you know the stuff inside and out, otherwise you're screwed.
Very well organized. Kind of boring, but overall she knows her stuff. Veteran prof. Study tip: NVM the readings; take notes in lecture, and just use slds= B+ to an A+

Apart from the fact that she is a really nice person, her teaching style is not effective at all. her tests are unfair and not clear. and her grading system is really rough. i personally, got bored during the lectures and felt that this is one of the most useless courses I've ever taken.

soso lol.hav to memorize a lot of thing.well..just memory the lecture notes is enough+lec tape..but. to get good on essay question. guess hav to study more on txtbook and video bah..we hav 2 essay question but there is one that is about video!!!(2003fall)
Her lectures are clear informative and fun, but they do not help at all with the midterms.  She often "hints" at possible midterm questions and then doesn't put them on the midterm.

Well she's a nice person but don't let the "no tutorial/hw and 4 tests" system fool you.  It's not easy to get an A cuz tests are marked pretty hard. Her classes are quite boring and there's just way too much info to memorize. Personally, I really hate this class.

Gives lots of information and communicates it very clearly.  Obviously interested in the subject but her tone of voice when doing the lectures is a bit drousy.  Exams really hard so make sure you study!

if it's interest in a subject you want from a prof, Dr. D'Andrea's it. organized, she'll tell you what she expects, tests are hard so do the readings, watch the videos! she's just good at what she does, easy to approach.
Wonderful prof.
She is informative but not terribly exciting, certainly not interesting enough to liven up a class with boring subject matter.  The lectures were difficult to sit through.
Good teacher, very helpful

Not bad--interesting enough so that you don't bang your head against a brick wall halfway through a 3 hour lectures.  Tests aren't too hard; tries to schedule tests during as non-busy weeks as possible.

I took this class as an elective.  I can honestly say that having graduated with two undergrad degrees and now working on a master's degree that this woman should not be teaching.  She might be intelligent but a PhD. does not that mean one can teach...
He is a great prof and he really cares about his students. His instructions for the tests were very clear and he had good study guides and PowerPoints.

Honestly, I had low expectations, but I enjoyed his class! Sometimes lectures were boring, but he is one of those professors that what he teaches, is exactly the content on quizzes and exams. Hard to find a prof like that at SFU. Overall, I recommend him!!
Nice man, but boring as a bag of rocks. I'm sure Arch 100 is an easy class, but it felt like pulling teeth trying to learn it from him.

super easy class, one midterm 45% & final 55%, all mc + t/f, didnt use the textbook at all, all exam material is from his lectures. he also records lectures & posts them so you dont have to show up. really nice and easy going guy, easy to meet with outside of class + super helpful & i would def recommend this course! awesome gpa booster

This course is perfect for an easy elective. It consumes hardly any time and the material is very simple and easy to understand. Arch 100 is the perfect course to get a good grade in, spend little time on and add some extra credits towards your degree. The course is graded on 3 exams (2 midterms and a final) all MC and cumulative.

If you are looking for a class with minimal assignments and one that you can do with relative ease, this is it. Prof. Berna only grades you on two midterms and a final and each comes with its own exam review guide which lays out EXACTLY what you will be examined on. The content was interesting and he definitely seems passionate about it as well.

ARCH100 is graded on 2 midterms and a final, no assignments. Class was pretty well taught, a bit dry a times but still good overall. Exams are easy, but the exam topics given before the exams can be a little bit vague on what exactly to read.
his class was very dry and boring. You need to be really good at memorizing, his class was a challenge because of that.

Lots of materials to cover, but overall exams are fair and easy if you know the general idea of everything. He takes attendance at the beginning of class which was the most difficult part for me. But overall, a great prof with a great sense of humor.
amazing prof with a sense of humor, tests are really easy. 1010 would take again

Francesco is an amazing prof! Although he has a strong italian accent he is hilarious. His lectures tend to be quite long since the class has A LOT of material to cover. But overall very good teacher. Always there for questions or concerns and tries his best to help students with make-up quizzes etc... I'm gonna miss him:( !

I took this class in a summer 2 years ago... the lecture was super dry and the contents are mostly based on the textbook. He had in class quizzes which we watch a video and write down answers to his question. But he wont tell you its a quiz after the video...the MT was long and the research paper is too much for an entry course!
hard

Seems like a knowledgeable guy. Teaching isn't really his thing though. He gives unclear instructions in regards to assignments and he difficult to talk to. He is your classic academic snob. Anything outside of lecture is definitely treated as if it?s a chore and a nuisance to him.

He seems like a perfectly fine, normal and approachable prof during lectures. However, one-on-one he is arrogant, rude, and generally unhelpful. It is my hope that SFU replaces him because this has been the only course at the University in which I had a particularly bad experience.

1.This course is not about ancient ppls/places. Prepare to memorize HIS accepted interpretations (the word "I" appears so much in the text it's ridiculous-yes he wrote the text) 2. He makes the study as boring as possible, and the text clearly rejects thinking upon ideas which are "already rejected" 3. TM totally useless, D.Evans

he has toooo high expectations. he answers unclearly when asking quesions. I was intereted in archaeology, but after taking this class with him i decided not to take any more arch courses. arch 100 felt definetly like a 300,400 course for me.

very egocentric and condescending. only his opinion is right. unapproachable and not helpful at all. is not clear, does not specify expectiations, or instructions for assignments. likes to embarrass students.

He seems very awkward. I went to ask him for help a couple of times, and each time, he would be awkward, and look at me as though I'm ridiculous. He is not friendly, and extremely abrupt outside of class. Definately not helpful. Take this course with another prof. He has too high expectations for a 100 level course for Beginners in archeology

One of the best classes I have taken. Interesting assignments. Took by dist ed. The tutor/marker was great--one of the most helpful I've ever had. I wish I could take another Arch course. If you work hard you will be rewarded with a decent grade.
pretty good, get ready to aggrandize

Expectations are not clearly defined and instructions for bizarre assignments are incomplete but your mark is still penalized. He is clearly very smart, more of an academic than a teacher. I appreciated his insights. The course material is easy and its pretty easy to get a good mark on the midterm (worth 40%) by regurgitating it. No final exam!

So far the best prof. I had. Lectures were a joy, lots of videos, artifacts, visuals. Great character, great scholar. I love him as a person and as a teacher. That's how a prof shoud be! Exams are fairly easy, marks are generous. Highly recommended.

The best prof I had so far. He knows his stuff, makes lectures v. interesting, lots of visual learning methods, very intelligent, charming personality. Ah... and he doesn't think he is the smartest person in the room. I took another course in arch. just because I like the man.
Awesome! makes you think in a new way. Very unique teaching style and fairly excentric. I loved his class!

Good class. Professor Hayden really knows his stuff and he makes the class very interesting. Lots of movies and he brings in real stone tools / weapons etc. His lectures can be a bit disorganized though.

Prof. Hayden is clearly a very intelligent man who knows his stuff. He gave great demos of prehistoric tool making (he actually made them!) and he really gets into his lectures. Generally, he was quite clear, but there was a few moments where he lost me. Assignments relevent and fair.
Professor Tremain has the cutest British English accent! The class average was a C+, but she's still an empathetic prof!

Cara is a super nice prof, she doesn't give any information on her slides or any extra notes on canvas because she wants you to attend the class, but that's totally fair and her classes are great. She's funny and also just genuinely very nice and passionate about what she teaches. Only exams for marks, no assignments. AWESOME PROF!!

Dr. Tremain was fantastic, we were graded on 3 midterms, but they were very fair, and she didn't focus on the dates for anyting, it was mostly focused on the concepts and people we learnt about in class. The lectures were 3hrs, but her enthusiasm really made them interesting, shes a good lecturer and was happy to talk during breaks and after class.
Amazing professor, always willing to help students. The slides provided are enough for the exams if you listen to him during the class as he gives hints about the questions he may ask in the exam.

Amazing teacher he teaches so well and has a lot of interest in students its so easy to pass if you know what do lets be real if you dont pass this you are the most inocent thing in the world or have no interest in the class
Probably the most interesting class at SFU so far. He is funny, has creative explanations, and is engaging. Get ready to memorize stuff on his slides. I wished the class would never end :((
Lovely prof. He is extremely nice and caring. His innocence and friendly nature with students go hand in hand. Will grade you fairly. Super nice much recommended
Amazing guy. He is so innocent that you would want to work and get good grades to not disappoint him. You will also probably cry in your last class with him, he's that nice. DEFINITELY RECOMMENDED!

Ernest himself is a fine prof, nice guy and pretty funny. However the course itself is absolutely brutal. It is the most boring course I have ever taken. There is so much memorization required. This course was not a GPA booster for me and many other people I know who took it. Unless greatly interested in prehistory, do not take this course.

This class was the worst experience. Do not recommend taking it as a GPA booster unless you're good at memorizing thousands of words and could remember weird and new ones too. No complaints towards the professor himself but the course is quite boring & he has way too many slides filled with fluff rather than important info that will be on the test

Took ARCH 100 summer intersession with this professor and it was the worst experiences of my uni career. A lot of slides to memorize and none of the slides made sense as they were put together pretty clumsily. Class average was usually around 65.2%. NOT RECOMMENDED TOUGH PROF

Taken 100, and 252 with him and can tell you with 100% confidence, don't buy the textbooks for these classes. Going off the lecture slides will guarantee a B or higher depending on how much you retain. Go to class and take notes of the things he talks about in detail. The exams are 50 MC and 1 short answer question. Reviews slides a day before.

Do not take as a GPA Booster, Midterms and Final were very hard, all multiple choice but very confusing I didn't do the textbook readings and I still got by just studying the lectures which were 100 slides per week  Just don't do it,

Do not take this course if you are looking for a GPA booster. This class covers so much information and it is difficult to memorize all of it. Lectures can get very boring as well. This course will ruin your GPA if you can't memorize 1000+ slides and the textbook.
exams basically cover everything, do not take this course with this professor IF you want a gpa booster

Nice prof but the class is very boring. Would not recommend this course unless you are interested in archaeology. Exams are difficult as it covers lots of information. The average for the first midterm was 63%. Definitely not a GPA booster.

He seems like a nice prof but his slides are kind of misleading.. he'll have things bolded in red that you think he would test you on but he doesn't. He'll test you on material written in black right down to the smallest detail. This class is probably only a GPA booster with a different instructor.

Ernest Bumann, in my opinion, is the BEST lecturer at SFU. Hands down. He gives solid lectures, is very knowledgeable about the subject and is absolutely hilarious! His lecture notes are all you'll need to do amazing on the exams. Rest assured, this will be your favourite course simply due to Bumann's enthusiastic teaching style.
Worst class ever, i don't understand a word he is saying and his lecture are just boring as hell... For the exam, make sure you read all the ppt and chapter, because he basically ask EVERYTHING

honestly, this guy is the best prof in the world. the people who are complaining about his exams being hard are probably the ones that never showed up because there was literally nothing that wasn't covered in class. he's amazing and if i could take any other classes with him i would. other profs should learn from this guy. hes simply wonderful.
as other said he is nice as a person but the subject its self is so boring and alot alot alot of information. I didn't enjoy the subject

he is a kind and fun person. However, he do nothing rather than giving lecture, the TA do everything. The exam is HARD.too much information. If you want to take Arch100 because you want a high or good mark. it's not the right course. I'm a B student( I never get D or F) BUT I got the first F in my life in this subject :( really stay away from arch

Ernest is an incredibly friendly guy and does a fantastic job at explaining things. If you're taking Arch 100, be prepared for a lot of information. This class covers the whole world over thousands of years. It's not easy remembering everything, but he emphasizes important points and tells you everything you need to know.

Friendly and interesting prof, very knowledgeable. Sometimes lectures are a bit slow and boring, but they're interesting for the most part if you enjoy arch. Exams are straightforward, read the textbook and lecture notes. If you miss class, its easy to catch up, he posts lecture slides online.

Really nice prof but dry lectures. Don't need to attend them because he has lecture recordings (at least this semester he does). Exams are not tricky, very straight forward. As long as you read the textbook and lecture notes you will be fine!

easy to get an A, but you need to go to lectures and memorize lots of places and dates. quizes are sometimes difficult, but the final was much better. no assignment in this class which makes a great elective

Some of the material in ARCH 100 are interesting, but some are dull.  The quizzes are not that easy.  To do well you have to understand his lecture notes well. There are lots of places and names that you need to know.  If you are good at memorizing places, names, and some dates, then this course is good to take.

Easy prof. If you are lazy and don't want to study, this is a great course, provided you can stay awake in lecture. If you listen, you will be ready for his tests without any studying. Course is very easy, everything is linked together. Easy to score an A in the course. Material a bit dry, but overall not bad

Easy course, but very boring lectures. Great prof if u could put up with how boring he is and get notes taken down. To get high grades it would be best to attend all lectures and not just sleep through them. Textbook isnt used too much.

It's true that this course is about memorizing lecture notes. But u hv to memorize tons and tons of dates and cultures and names of some mysterious images etc. And his lectures are really boring with his monotone. It's pulling down my GPA crazily.

Really nice guy, had the most helpful slides ever! don't really need to read the book but if you study the slides (and pics!) you should be okay. No final or midterm just 4 25% quizzes (only one of which was difficult). Definatly recomend this class!
a good gpa booster. Highly recommended. Also - the prof is a nice funny guy.
I love how this class was set up - 4 quizzes, 25% each. Bob is a great teacher... funny too. Quiz material was based all on lectures; the textbook was completely pointless.

Bob is the best prof ever! Easy, concise and striaghtforward. He is very clear when he speaks and gets the point across well, lectures are worth going to. His mark breakdown is extremely easy, no midterms,finals,term papers,labs or tutorials. Just 4 quizzes worth 25% each which are only on 3 chapters at a time, which makes it easy. You'll thank me!

Quizzes are all from his power point slides (printing them off before class saves writing too many notes). He'll tell you to read the textbook, but it's not really necessary unless you want a great deal of background information. Do remember to study the pictures in his notes... he's not lying when he says he'll be putting slides on the quizzes!
I wish I were patient enough to take other classes with Bob.  Great sense of humour, and pretty easy marker.  He was really easy to talk to outside of class.
Notes are never released to students until 10 minutes before the class, which is useless. This course is easy only when u are excellent in pure memorization.
No Comments
this dudes a ****! he is very prompt on webct/emails. you learn something and get a good mark in the process.

Class could get boring at times, but he usually kept it going at a good pace. Really good sense of humour. Only real beef is with the instructions he gave for the second quiz: he told us not to worry about studying specific sites, then gave us a bunch of questions about specific sites! That wasn't cool. Overall a really good prof though.
THIS CLASS IS TOO BORING BUT ITS REALLY EASY YOU DONT EVEN HAVE TO GO TO CLASS TO GET AN A

I found the clas really great! Hes so clear on what he want you to know and what you need to know for the quizes. the content was really interesting too. Good pic for lecture. He made it really easy to do well in his course and he seems nice, has a good sense of unexpected humour too.knows what hes talking about for sure.Over all really great clas
An easy course. Study the notes and go to the lectures and you'll be fine. Bob's a great prof.

Went nuts on the second test- spite isn't nice Bob! However, an amazing lecturer, so clear and interesting. Can be funny at times, but also makes this "I want to destroy the world" face at the bigging of most classes. Is he really angry? We will never know. Also very helpful on webct and seems to know an aweful lot. He doesn't look like a potato!
